Used for creating yearly, weekly etc ver: Used for creating yearly, weekly etc versions of base plan. Child plans will inherit their parent permissions/features.
How much subscribers of this plan should: How much subscribers of this plan should be charged. (Dollars, euros etc.)
For example, Amount=100, Interval=Year a: For example, Amount=100, Interval=Year and Interval Count=1, will charge user 100 dollars every year.
Plan amount can't be changed once plan h: Plan amount can't be changed once plan has already been created, however you can add a new child plan with a different price or delete this plan and create a new one.
The frequency with which a subscription: The frequency with which a subscription should be billed.
The number of intervals (specified in th: The number of intervals (specified in the interval property above) between each subscription billing. For example, Interval=Month and Interval Count=3 bills every 3 months.
Order of plans. Lower position will appe: Order of plans. Lower position will appear first.
Plan will be marked as \"Most Popular\": Plan will be marked as "Most Popular" and emphasized to users.
Basic free plan that will be assigned to: Basic free plan that will be assigned to new users that have not upgraded to other plans.

Which method should be used for storing: Which method should be used for storing and retrieving cached items.
\"File\" is the best option for most cas: "File" is the best option for most cases and should not be changed, unless you are familiar with another cache method and have it set up on the server already.

Here you can create policies that will b: Here you can create policies that will be shown on registration page and user will be required to accept them by toggling a checkbox.
Base site url is set as \":baseUrl\" in: Base site url is set as ":baseUrl" in configuration, but current url is ":currentUrl". It's recommended to set the primary url you want to use in configuration file and then redirect all other url versions to this primary version via cpanel or .htaccess file.

Select active queue method and enter rel: Select active queue method and enter related 3rd party API keys.
Queues allow to defer time consuming tas: Queues allow to defer time consuming tasks, such as sending an email, until a later time. Deferring these tasks can speed up web requests to the application.
All methods except sync require addition: All methods except sync require additional setup, which should be performed before changing the queue method. Consult documentation for more information.
Configure google recaptcha integration a: Configure google recaptcha integration and credentials.
Only change endpoint if you are using an: Only change endpoint if you are using another S3 compatible storage service.
Configure size and type of files that us: Configure size and type of files that users are able to upload. This will affect all uploads across the site.
Both X-Sendfile and X-Accel need to be e: Both X-Sendfile and X-Accel need to be enabled on the server first. When enabled it will reduce server memory and CPU usage when previewing or downloading files, especially for large files.
When enabled larger files will be upload: When enabled larger files will be uploaded in smaller chunks to improve upload reliability and avoid server max upload size limits.
Size for each file chunk. Recommended si: Size for each file chunk. Recommended size is 2MB-5MB. Must be lower then max upload file size on your server.
Allow users to resume partial or failed: Allow users to resume partial or failed uploads.
Maximum size for a single file user can: Maximum size for a single file user can upload.
Disk space each user uploads are allowed: Disk space each user uploads are allowed to take up. This can be overridden per user.
List of allowed file types (jpg, mp3, pd: List of allowed file types (jpg, mp3, pdf etc.). Leave empty to allow all file types.
Prevent uploading of these file types, e: Prevent uploading of these file types, even if they are allowed above.
Maximum upload size on your server curre: Maximum upload size on your server currently is set to
Disk space available to user. If left em: Disk space available to user. If left empty, it will be inherited from value set in "admin -> settings -> uploading" page.
